summary: Book Library Renaming and Documentation Project

content.text: can you please run ls in the current directory and look at the files in here

These are all books or folders that contain books with files related to the books. What I'd like you to do is look at all the file names and suggest a common format that we can use for all the book names. Some of them are missing certain things, like some are missing a year, some missing an author. That's okay. We can go back and maybe try to find the author in the year that it was published and populate that, but suggest a format for me that would be good. I want to have like nice human readable format. I'll be wanting to use spaces rather than dashes or underscores for like space characters. And I think I'd like to start with the title of the book.

content.content:

content.text:
Based on the files in your books directory, I can see you have a mix of technical books in various formats (PDF, EPUB) with inconsistent naming patterns. Here's a suggested format that would work well for your collection:

## Suggested Format:
**`Title - Author (Year)`**

This format puts the title first (as you requested), followed by the author and publication year in parentheses. Here are some examples of how your current files would look:

**Current examples transformed:**
- `A Common-Sense Guide to Data Structures and Algorithms - Jay Wengrow (2017)`
- `A Tour of C++ - Bjarne Stroustrup (2022)`
- `AI Engineering Building Applications with Foundation Models - Chip Huyen (2024)`
- `Build a Large Language Model From Scratch - Sebastian Raschka (2024)`
- `Computer Systems A Programmer's Perspective - Randal Bryant, David O'Hallaron (2015)`

**Benefits of this format:**
- Title-first for easy browsing
- Spaces instead of underscores/dashes (as requested)
- Consistent author placement
- Year helps identify editions
- Readable and scannable
- Works well with file sorting

**For missing information:**
- If author is missing: `Title (Year)` or just `Title`
- If year is missing: `Title - Author` 
- If both missing: just `Title`

This format is clean, human-readable, and will make your collection much more organized and browsable.

This looks great can you please go through each file at the top level of this books directory, do not go into the folders and attempt to do this on their contents. Can you also add a readme to this that gives a high level overview of the contents of this library of books.

input.content:
# Technical Library Collection

A curated collection of technical books covering computer science, software engineering, and programming topics. All books follow the naming convention: `Title - Author (Year)`.

## Collection Overview

### Programming Languages & Fundamentals
- **C/C++**: Modern C, C++ in One Hour a Day, A Tour of C++, Elements of Programming
- **Go**: Distributed Services with Go, Let's Go series (web development tutorials)
- **Rust**: Zero to Production in Rust
- **Python**: Hypermodern Python Tooling
- **TypeScript**: Effective TypeScript
- **Elixir**: Build a Weather Station with Elixir and Nerves
- **Functional Programming**: Grokking Simplicity

### Computer Systems & Architecture
- **Operating Systems**: Operating Systems Three Easy Pieces, The Linux Kernel
- **Computer Architecture**: Computer Architecture A Quantitative Approach
- **Computer Systems**: Computer Systems A Programmer's Perspective
- **Compilers**: Compilers Principles Techniques and Tools, Writing an Interpreter in Go, Writing a Compiler in Go, Writing a C Compiler

### Software Engineering & Design
- **Architecture**: Fundamentals of Software Architecture, Enterprise Integration Patterns
- **Design Patterns**: Applying UML and Patterns
- **Code Quality**: Working Effectively with Legacy Code, Tidy First, The Programmers Brain
- **Static Analysis**: Static Program Analysis
- **Version Control**: Building Git

### Databases & Data
- **Database Theory**: Foundations of Databases
- **PostgreSQL**: PostgreSQL Internals 14
- **Data Structures**: A Common-Sense Guide to Data Structures and Algorithms
- **Algorithms**: The Algorithm Design Manual

### Distributed Systems & Cloud
- **Distributed Systems**: Distributed Systems (Tanenbaum), Distributed Systems for Fun and Profit, Introduction to Reliable and Secure Distributed Programming
- **Serverless**: Serverless For Everyone Else
- **Containers**: The Book of Kubernetes

### Machine Learning & AI
- **Large Language Models**: Build a Large Language Model From Scratch, Hands-On Large Language Models
- **AI Engineering**: AI Engineering Building Applications with Foundation Models

### Development Tools & Practices
- **Debugging**: Building a Debugger
- **Mathematics**: Math for Programming

### Special Topics
- **Food Science**: The Food Lab Better Home Cooking Through Science
- **Coffee**: The Professional Barista's Handbook
- **Programming Culture**: We Programmers A Chronicle of Coders from Ada to AI

### Tutorial Series
- **Go Web Development**: Complete Let's Go and Let's Go Further tutorials with source code
- **Compiler Construction**: Writing an Interpreter/Compiler in Go with complete source code examples

## Collection Statistics
- **Total Books**: ~45 technical books
- **Formats**: PDF, EPUB, DJVU
- **Primary Focus**: Systems programming, software architecture, and modern development practices
- **Includes**: Complete source code for several tutorial series

## Organization
Books are organized alphabetically by title at the root level. Tutorial series with accompanying materials are kept in dedicated folders with their complete resources (HTML, source code, etc.).
